data.name: GPT-3
data.description: A state-of-the-art language model developed by OpenAI.

data.name: BERT
data.description: A transformer-based language representation model developed by Google.

data.name: ResNet
data.description: A deep convolutional neural network for image recognition.ResNet, short for Residual Network, is a deep convolutional neural network architecture developed by researchers at Microsoft Research.

data.name: DeepSpeech
data.description: DeepSpeech is an open-source speech-to-text engine developed by Mozilla. It utilizes deep learning techniques, specifically recurrent neural networks (RNNs), to transcribe spoken language into text. DeepSpeech is trained on large datasets of human speech and text transcriptions, enabling it to accurately recognize and transcribe spoken words.

data.name: AlphaGo
data.description: A computer program developed by DeepMind to play the board game Go.AlphaGo combines deep neural networks with reinforcement learning techniques to learn from data and improve its gameplay over time. It uses a combination of supervised learning from human expert games and reinforcement learning from self-play to continuously refine its strategy. AlphaGo's success demonstrated the power of deep learning and reinforcement learning in tackling complex problems and marked a significant advancement in AI

data.name: YOLO
data.description: You Only Look Once (YOLO) is an object detection system.YOLO (You Only Look Once) is a popular object detection system developed by Joseph Redmon and Ali Farhadi.

data.name: LSTM
data.description: Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) is a type of recurrent neural network (RNN) architecture.YOLO divides the input image into a grid and predicts bounding boxes and class probabilities for each grid cell simultaneously. This approach makes YOLO well-suited for applications requiring real-time object detection, such as autonomous vehicles, surveillance systems, and augmented reality.

data.name: VGG16
data.description: VGG16 is a convolutional neural network model that won the ImageNet competition.

data.name: Tacotron
data.description: Tacotron is a sequence-to-sequence model for generating speech waveform from text.

data.name: WaveNet
data.description: WaveNet is a deep generative model developed by DeepMind for generating raw audio waveforms. Unlike traditional speech synthesis methods, which rely on concatenative or parametric approaches, WaveNet generates speech samples one sample at a time, directly from the waveform. This approach allows WaveNet to capture detailed nuances of natural speech, resulting in high-quality and natural-sounding synthetic speech.

data.name: MobileNet
data.description: MobileNet is a lightweight deep learning model architecture designed for efficient inference on mobile and embedded devices. It was developed by researchers at Google. MobileNet is specifically optimized for low-latency, low-power consumption, and small model size, making it suitable for applications requiring real-time performance on resource-constrained devices.

data.name: VGG19
data.description: VGG19 is a convolutional neural network (CNN) architecture that is an extension of the VGG16 model. It was developed by the Visual Geometry Group (VGG) at the University of Oxford. Similar to VGG16, VGG19 consists of 19 layers, including convolutional layers, max-pooling layers, and fully connected layers.

data.name: AlexNet
data.description: AlexNet is one of the pioneering deep convolutional neural network architectures.
data.provider: Alex Krizhevsky, Ilya Sutskever, Geoffrey Hinton

data.name: Inception
data.description: Inception is a deep convolutional neural network architecture developed by Google.

data.name: FastText
data.description: FastText is a library for efficient learning of word representations and sentence classification.

data.name: Word2Vec
data.description: Word2Vec is a shallow, two-layer neural network model for learning word embeddings.

data.name: U-Net
data.description: U-Net is a convolutional neural network architecture for biomedical image segmentation.
data.provider: Olaf Ronneberger, Philipp Fischer, Thomas Brox
